intro: Styphelia tameiameiae var. societas, commonly known as the Socotra starflower, is a unique evergreen shrub native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has leathery, dark green leaves that are arranged in a dense, compact form. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
